entry.title: Actor Matthew Broderick: Our Son Is "Curious" About Smoking
entry.summary: He and <b>Sarah Jessica Parker</b> may have given the five-year-old the "gene of a smoker," he says
entry.content:
Matthew Broderick admits that he and wife Sarah Jessica Parker (aka "Carrie Bradshaw") still smoke – and he predicts it will rub off on their 5-year-old son, James
Wilkie.

"[He's] already curious," Broderick told New York.

"I can just see the little budding gene of a smoker in there," Broderick said. "He'll see a cigarette butt and say, 'What is that? Why do people smoke?'"

As for his own smoking habit, Broderick revealed: "I used to smoke cigarettes, and I still do, lately. I gave that up a long time ago, but every now and then I will fall off for a week."

Sex and the City star Parker is "worse than me on that," Broderick added.

Norman H. Edelman — chief medical officer with the American Lung Association — tells Us, "Children of smokers are much more likely to become smokers themselves," adding that more than 438,000 people die each year in the U.S. from smoking-related illnesses.

For information on how to quit, call the American Lung Association's Lung HelpLine at 1-800-LUNGUSA, or visit www.lungusadc.org.

entry.title: Mike Myer's Love Guru Slammed By Critics
entry.summary: "[It] is downright antifunny," <i>New York Times</i> reviewer says
entry.content:
Mike Myer's Love Guru – which hits theaters today – is getting slammed by critics.

"What is the opposite of a belly laugh?" New York Times reviewer A.O. Scott wrote. "[It] is downright antifunny, an experience that makes you wonder if you will ever laugh again."

Scott said "unfunny" and "obnoxious" do "not quite capture the strenuous unpleasantness" of Myer's portrayal of the main character Guru Pitka.

"To say that the movie is not funny is merely to affirm the obvious," Scott added.

The New York Post's critic quipped, "If this movie were a president, it would be Tedious Roosevelt."

Variety called the film "relentlessly juvenile" and the Associated Press reviewer blamed Myers: "From the credits of this scattershot comedy sketch stretched and strained to movie length, Myers clearly loved himself to the point of narcissism going in."

Read additional scathing Love Guru reviews.

(See summer's hot movie couples.)

entry.title: Angelina Jolie Staying "Home With the Kids" Until Twins Are Born
entry.summary: She and <b>Brad Pitt</b> have "made a point to ... not be working," she says
entry.content:
In a new interview with USA Today, Angelina Jolie wouldn't reveal her due date (Kung Fu Panda co-star Dustin Hoffman said it's August).

But she did share how she and Brad Pitt are prepping for their twins.

"We've made a point to, both of us, not be working," she says. "So we'll be home together with the kids.

"At the same time we're expecting two, we have four, so my focus now is on the four we have," she says of daughter Shiloh, 2; Maddox, 6; Pax, 4; Zahara, 3.

"And these are some big times for them, big moments in their lives," she adds. "So every day is just about making sure that their schooling is going right and their manners are intact and we're disciplining properly and we're spending enough time with them individually, so they seem special. That's a lot of balance when you have a lot of children."

(See photos of Angelina and her kids.)

Pitt does his part as well.

"I'm very lucky — I'm with a man who makes me feel very sexy pregnant and loves children," Jolie says. "In the last few months it's hard for me to pick up the other kids, so he's there to help lift them up to me and things like that.

(See Us' photo gallery of Angelina's baby bump.)

"He's an extremely hands-on dad with all the kids and really, really supportive," she adds. "Any woman knows that when you're pregnant, if you have a partner who is embracing it with you and excited with you, it makes all the difference. I'm very lucky to have him."

(See photos of Brad and Angelina kissing.)

entry.title: Britney Spears Recording New Album
entry.summary: Producer Jim Beanz tells <b>Us</b> “we never see anything but positives out of her”
entry.content:
Britney Spears is currently at work on an upcoming album, her vocal producer and co-writer Jim Beanz confirms exclusively to Usmagazine.com.

"Britney is amazing," Beanz (recipient of the famed Eurovision Award for his song "Believe") tells Us.

The singer, 26, has had her share of drama, but "we never see anything but positives out of her.

"Everyone has personal stuff, but a true professional doesn't bring it into the studio," adds Beanz, who just opened his own studio, Sunset Entertainment Group, in Bryn Mawr, Pa.

In April, her former manager Larry Rudolph told Us that Spears — who is currently in Kentwood, celebrating sister Jamie Lynn's new baby girl Maddie — had gone into the studio "just for fun."

Added Rudolph, "she is on the right path."

Spears' last album, Blackout, debuted at No. 2 on the U.S. Billboard 200. The first single "Gimme More" was her most successful single in the U.S. since "...Baby One More Time."

(See photos of Britney's bikini body.)

Tell Us: What's your favorite Britney song?

entry.title: Alli Sims: Jamie Lynn Spears "Going to Have Fun" With Maddie
entry.summary: She tells <b>Us</b> the 17-year-old and fiance <b>Casey Aldridge</b> are "just so excited"
entry.content:
Jamie Lynn Spears' cousin Alli Sims says the 17-year-old will make a great mom to daughter Maddie.

"I'm sure the baby's beautiful, and I'm so glad everybody's healthy and doing well," Sims told Usmagazine.com at an after-party for Wanted in Los Angeles on Thursday.

"I just wish them all the happiness in the world," she said. "I know they're going to have so much fun."

(See Us' photo gallery of Jamie Lynn Spears' baby bump.)

Sims — who said she is still "great friends" with Britney (who's recording a new album) — added that she plans on sending "something cute.

"I'm sure they're doing great," she told Us. "I know they're just so excited."

Maddie was born Thursday at Mississippi Southwest Regional Medical Center in McComb, Mississippi.

She weighed 7 lbs., 11 ounces.

(Read what an expert had to say about the baby name Maddie.)

entry.title: Naomi Campbell Pleads Guilty to Airport Attack
entry.summary: She was sentenced to 200 hours community service for hitting two cops
entry.content:
Naomi Campbell pleaded guilty Friday to assaulting two police officers at London's Heathrow Airport.

She was sentenced to 200 hours of community service. She must complete it within 12 months.

After the sentencing, her rep said, "One thing I would say about her is that she's incredibly hard working, and she's not scared of hard work. She can handle whatever she's asked to do.

"She is very, very relieved it is over and she has been treated fairly," the rep said. "The whole thing is regrettable, she knows that."

(See photos of your favorite 90s models.)

Campbell was arrested in April aboard a British Airways flight when she threw a fit after her carry-on bags came up missing. She was removed from the plane and held for eight hours at the airport police station before being released.

Though a British Airways rep would not comment on the case, the spokesperson suggested that Campbell has been banned by the airline.

"We take all cases of disruptive behavior extremely seriously and take action where appropriate," the rep said in a statement. "We have banned people from traveling with us in the past, and we reserve the right to ban passengers."

Last year, Campbell was ordered to spend a week mopping floors at a NYC warehouse for assaulting her maid with a cell phone.

entry.title: Paula Abdul and Restaurateur Beau Split
entry.summary: The <i>Idol</i> judge "is doing fine" after breaking up with <b>J.T. Torregiani</b>
entry.content:
Paula Abdul has split from boyfriend, restaurateur J.T. Torregiani, her rep confirms to Usmagazine.com.

The pair parted ways more than two months ago. Torregiani, 33 — a partner in the Dolce Group — has moved out of the American Idol judge's Los Angeles home.

“She’s doing fine," a source close to Abdul, 46, tells Us. "She has moved on with her life.”

(See photos of other newly single stars.)

Abdul and Torregiani began dating in April 2007 when he introduced himself to her after an Idol taping.

In June 2007, he threw her a 45th birthday party at Ketchup, the West Hollywood eatery he co-owns.

"He's a sweetie pie," she told USA Today last October. "He's a positive force that has come into my life right now. Where it leads, who knows?"

Abdul told the paper that a baby was "the next step in my life.

"Definitely within the next two years," she said. "I thought by now I'd have three grown children."

entry.title: Why Jamie Lynn Spears Named Her Daughter "Maddie Briann"
entry.summary: A baby name expert tells <b>Us</b> the choice is "surprising"
entry.content:
Jamie Lynn Spears and Casey Aldridge's decision to name their newborn daughter Maddie Briann is "a surprising choice," baby name expert Pam Satran, coauthor of baby-naming guides Cool Names and The Baby Name Bible, tells Usmagazine.com.

"[Maddie is] cute but nearly old-fashioned at this point," Satran says. "The nickname Maddie has been popular in its own right since the 1980s, when it was the name used by the character played by Cybill Shepherd in Moonlighting."

The name is short for Madeline (the French variation of Magdalen, which is Greek for "high tower) or Madison (of English origin, meaning "son of the mighty warrior"), which was a top name several years ago, Satran explains.

"Both Jamie and Maddie are '80s-style nickname names," Satran adds. "Rather than mother and daughter, they sound like classmates – co-captains of the cheerleading squad!"

(Check out pics of Jamie Lynn's baby bump.)

As for Maddie's middle name, Briann, Satran reveals its "a modern feminization of Brian, Irish for 'strong.'

Briann, Brian, Brianne and Brianna have been trending downward over the past several years, Satran points out.

Jamie Lynn gave birth to Maddie Thursday at Mississippi Southwest Regional Medical Center in McComb, Mississippi. Maddie – Jamie Lynn and Aldridge's first child – weighed 7 lbs., 11 ounces.

Tell Us: Do you like the name Maddie Briann?

entry.title: Jamie Lynn Spears Gives Birth to a Girl
entry.content:
Jamie Lynn Spears has given birth, a source tells Usmagazine.com.

Daughter Maddie was born Thursday at Mississippi Southwest Regional Medical Center in McComb, Mississippi.

Maddie weighed 7 lbs., 11 ounces.

This is the first child for 17-year-old actress and her 19-year-old fiance Casey Aldridge, a pipe layer.

(Check out pics of Jamie Lynn's baby bump.)

On Wednesday, sister Britney and dad Jamie flew from L.A. to their hometown of Kentwood, Louisiana as Jamie Lynn prepared to give birth.

(See photos of the famous siblings.)

The Zoey 101 star – who announced she was expecting at 16-years-old with Aldridge's baby in December (they sold the story for $1 million) – spent her pregnancy in Kentwood and McComb.

"She's now really excited, so I'm proud of her," pal Miley Cyrus has told Usmagazine.com.

Before her pregnancy, Jamie Lynn told Us of having kids, "Whatever happens, happens, I guess. You can't really say what is going to happen."

(Check out other shocking teen pregnancies.)

In May, Britney and mom Lynne attended her baby shower at the family's Serenity mansion in Kentwood.

Jamie Lynn and Aldridge got engaged in March and have delayed their wedding until after the birth of their child. At the time, Jamie Lynn wore a T-shirt emblazoned with the phrase "The Rumors Are True" while she flashed her engagement ring.

In April, the couple celebrated Jamie Lynn's 17th birthday together while her parents looked after Britney in L.A.

Jamie Lynn passed her GED in February. She has said it "would be fun" to attend Louisiana State University.

Tell Us: Do you think Jamie Lynn and Casey will be good parents?

entry.title: Britney Spears' Mom Tells Court: She "Intends to Return to Louisiana"
entry.summary: The singer stayed in California for her children's sake, <b>Lynne Spears</b> says
entry.content:
Britney Spears "intends to return to Louisiana," her mom Lynne says in a declaration to the L.A. Superior Court filed Tuesday obtained by Usmagazine.com.

"Britney has spent a majority of her time over the last five years in the state of California due in part to work but primarily with respect to a custody dispute currently ongoing," Lynne explains.

Britney's ex Kevin Federline has primary custody of their two young children, Jayden James and Sean Preston.

At Tuesday's hearing, the court commissioner granted Britney's father Jamie permission to sell the singer's six-bedroom home in Beverly Hills, CA. (Because her father is her co-conservator, the decision to sell the home required a court's approval.)

(See photos of Britney and her parents through the years.)

Though she has spent most of her time in Beverly Hills, Britney has owned a home in their hometown of Kentwood, Louisiana for the past eight years.

Britney and Jamie flew to Kentwood Wednesday for the birth of Britney's younger sister Jamie Lynn's baby, Maddie Briann, Thursday.

(See childhood photos of Britney and Jamie Lynn.)

Tell Us: Should Britney move back to Kentwood?
